Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Fix critical bug: wrote=0 now properly reported as FAILURE

Critical bugs fixed:
1. When InfluxDB write returns wrote=0, now properly logs DOWNLOAD_FAILURE 
   instead of DOWNLOAD_SUCCESS
2. Raises RuntimeError to stop execution instead of continuing silently
3. Prevents misleading "completed successfully" messages when write failed

Changes in manager.py:
- Line 2127-2157: EOD branch now checks wrote=0 and fails properly
- Line 3100-3131: Intraday branch now checks wrote=0 and fails properly
- Both branches now set write_success=False when wrote=0
- Added clear error messages: "DOWNLOAD_FAILED - wrote 0 rows to InfluxDB"
- Raises RuntimeError to propagate failure up the call stack

This prevents the confusing situation where:
- Validation says "All checks passed - data will be saved"
- InfluxDB write fails with connection error
- Log shows "DOWNLOAD_SUCCESS: rows=858 wrote=0" (contradictory)
- System continues as if everything is OK

Now it will:
- Log SAVE_FAILURE when InfluxDB write exception occurs
- Log DOWNLOAD_FAILURE when wrote=0
- Raise exception to stop execution and alert user
- Show clear error: "downloaded X rows but wrote 0"

Note: This does not fix the InfluxDB connectivity issue itself - user must
still ensure InfluxDB is running at http://127.0.0.1:8181
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add log file rotation with 300-row limit and part numbering

Improvements to DataConsistencyLogger:
- Limit each log file to maximum 300 rows to prevent performance degradation
- Automatic file rotation with _part001, _part002, ... numbering
- Part numbers are zero-padded to 3 digits \(supports up to 999 parts per day\)
- When a part file reaches 300 rows, new logs go to next part number
- Query methods automatically read and combine all part files

Changes in logger.py:
- _persist_log_entry\(\): Rewritten to implement part file rotation logic
  - Searches for existing part files for the date
  - Checks if last part has room \(< 300 rows\)
  - Appends to last part if space available, otherwise creates new part
- get_logs\(\): Updated documentation to clarify it reads all part files
- Class docstring: Updated to document new file naming pattern and rotation

File naming pattern:
  Before: log_2024-12-25_AAL-option-1d.parquet \(unlimited rows\)
  After:  log_2024-12-25_AAL-option-1d_part001.parquet \(max 300 rows\)
          log_2024-12-25_AAL-option-1d_part002.parquet \(if first full\)

Benefits:
- Prevents massive log files that slow down read-modify-write operations
- Better performance when appending logs during long download sessions
- Maintains backward compatibility \(old pattern still readable\)
- Transparent to users \(get_logs\(\) automatically combines all parts\)
EOF
\)")
